Near offered $30k in prizes and chose 6 winners among 47 submitted projects:\\\\n\\\\n- DeFi Brain\\\\n- Connor AI\\\\n- Agent Smith\\\\n- Sealeon\\\\n- Gajami\\\\n- Illusion Blaze\\\\n\\\\nI\\\\\\'m requesting $USDT 30000 to administed the bounty payouts through NEAR Heroes platform. Each winning team will get from $3000 to $10000 according to their hackathon placement.\\\\n\\\\n[This expense was approved](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1oGb1q6yUhFq6Lc3V3fvy7Wnqg91yGcTZ0NNhM8mFIbI/edit?usp=sharing) by the Events Committee within the NEAR DevHub Q2 budget proposal on April 19th, 2024.", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "devhub-payouts.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "30000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDT"}, "labels": ["Bounty"]}

{"body": {"name": "ETHBerlin + BREW Conference Coding Session Proposal ", "summary": "NEAR presence at Berlin Blockchain Week: Brew Berlin sponsorship including a workshop and a coding session + support at ETHBerlin hackathon", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": null, "description": "This is more than a usual hackathon sponsorship. This proposal includes:\\\\n- Having a code workshop at BREW 1 day prior to the ETHBerlin hackathon start\\\\n- Making teams build on NEAR at the ETHBerlin Hackathon (incentivize them with bounty booster)\\\\n\\\\n**Why BREW?**\\\\n- Research & Dev Focused Chain Agnostic Event\\\\n- 1 day prior to ETHBerlin\\\\n- 250 visitors expected\\\\n- Berlin Native - involved with local web3 developer community for +7 years\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n1. Event Overview\\\\nTitle: ETHBerlin activation\\\\nDate & Format: 24.05.2024 In-Person\\\\nLocation: BREW conference for Coding Session & ETHBerlin Hackathon\\\\n\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\n2. Attending Team\\\\nMaria Magdalena Neu @mariamneu.near\\\\nMaria Yarotska @yarotska.near\\\\nBoris Polania @bpolania.near\\\\nSupporting: Mintbase local community members\\\\n\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\n3. Event Objectives\\\\nGoals: Engage Developers to build their ETHBerlin hacks on Near. Effectively Dev Acquisition & Retention\\\\nTarget Audience: Developers that will be attending ETHBerlin Hackathon. Obviously looking for Rust developers, but also calling in Solidity and AI interested devs.\\\\n\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\n4. Challenges & Themes\\\\nThe Coding Session will be led by @bpolania.near from NEAR DevHub. We are aiming to get a room for 2 hours where teams will first learn about possibilities on NEAR and then be incentivized to submit something. Each Submission (each TEAM) will be rewarded with 150USD.\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\n\\\\n5. Schedule  \\\\nThe activation at BREW - which happens 1 day prior to ETHBERLIN - is supposed to make teams familiar with building on NEAR. Getting them familiar with all we have to offer.\\\\nIllia will hopefully be able to speak on the main stage and call devs to the workshop hosted in the afternoon at the same location, where they will learn and do a mini-hack activity. \\\\nFor these activities there\\\\u{2019}s the possibility to include Mintbase Templates (getting them involved), using Minsta. \\\\n\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\n**Key Activities: **\\\\nBREW, as mentioned, is a chain agnostic 1 day long conference that happens very close to the ETHBerlin location on the day prior to ETHBerlin start. They have Polygon as the other speciality sponsor - their main narrative is AI & Near would be focusing on chain abstraction.\\\\nOur workshop is planned in the afternoon at which the following themes will be talked about:\\\\n- presentation of the bounty booster\\\\n- hacking chain abstraction on Near\\\\n- mintbase Templates / mintbase wallet (supports ETH too)\\\\n\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\n6. KPIs and Impact\\\\nKey Performance Indicators:\\\\n- Workshop attendees \\\\u{2013} 50 people\\\\n- Workshop Submissions \\\\u{2013} 10 submissions\\\\n- ETHBerlin on Near Submissions \\\\u{2013} 10 submissions\\\\n- ETHBerlin Hackathon winners which built on NEAR \\\\u{2013} 1 winner\\\\n\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\nCommunity Impact: \\\\n- Visibility to what\\\\u{2019}s possible on NEAR in contrast to what isn\\\\u{2019}t yet on other layer ones \\\\n- Chain Abstraction on Near expansion \\\\n- New startups funneled into NEAR HZN\\\\n\\\\n7. Budget and Funding\\\\n\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\nBudget Breakdown: see [Budget Link](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1OB4K3q-LAVOOEGuqExDMb0H2LlF4pXH_Z7mjXzcb2Mc/edit?usp=sharing)\\\\n\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\nTotal Funding Requested: 23334 EUR\\\\nRequested prior to event: $19,635 (excluding submission incentives and bounty booster)\\\\n\\\\n8. Bounties and Prizes\\\\n\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\nDetails: submission incentive (max 20 x 150 USD), bounty booster for ETHBerlin separate\\\\n\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\n9. Marketing and Promotion\\\\nThe hackathon at ETHBerlin does not need promotion. The coding session will be to promote NEAR to be used at the hackathon.\\\\n\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\t\\\\n10. Contact Information\\\\nContact Details: mariamneu telegram / mariamagneu twitter/ neumariamagdalena@gmail.com email \\\\n\\\\nSponsorship Deal with BREW Berlin: Speciality Sponsor custom package (initial price $20k)\\\\n\\\\nOur adjustments:\\\\n \\\\u{2043} Roundtable and panel discussion will be taken out \\\\n \\\\u{2043} Workshop time will be increased to 2 hours total \\\\n \\\\u{2043} $5k discount", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "devhub-payouts.nea", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "19635", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Hackbox", "Event sponsorship"]}

{"body": {"name": "NEAR Toronto Hackathon Proposal [Hackbox Cohort 1 - Q2 2024] | #PoweredByHackbox", "summary": "#PoweredByHackbox: NEAR Toronto and HawkHacks (LCS) are proud to partner to bring together the 2024 HawkHacks hackathon in Waterloo (Canada) a global tech and innovation hub. ", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": "yarotska.near", "description": "NEAR Toronto Hackathon Proposal [Hackbox Cohort 1 - Q2 2024] | #PoweredByHackbox\\\\nRequested amount: $10,000\\\\n\\\\nI am pleased to confirm that after applying through the official Hackbox intake form and undergoing the screening process by the Hackbox Team @yarotska.near and @nneoma.near, our team has been accepted into Hackbox Cohort 1 - Q2 2024\\\\n\\\\n**1. Hackathon Overview**\\\\n\\\\nTitle: NEAR Toronto Hackathon\\\\nDates: May 17 - May 31st, 2024\\\\nFormat: Online and IRL; 2-week duration\\\\nLocations:\\\\n\\\\nOnline May 17th - 31st\\\\nIn-Person May 17th - 19th:\\\\nWaterloo, Ontario, Canada (HawkHacks Collaboration)\\\\n\\\\n**2. Organizing Team**\\\\n\\\\nLead Organizers:\\\\nWe are thrilled to announce the launch of the NEAR Toronto Regional Community, a vibrant community dedicated to fostering collaboration, innovation, and growth in the Toronto region\\\\u{2019}s blockchain ecosystem. Join us on this exciting journey as we connect like-minded individuals, provide valuable resources, and nurture a thriving blockchain community.\\\\n\\\\nKey Figures:\\\\nSal C\\\\nLeadership\\\\nNEAR Toronto, Tenamint\\\\nShawn B\\\\nPartnerships/Sponsorships\\\\nNEAR Toronto, Seahorse Social, Tenamint\\\\nAndrew L\\\\nLogistics and Operations\\\\nNEAR Toronto, Droplinked, Waterloo Blockchain\\\\nAlex A\\\\nWorkshops, Education, Technical\\\\nNEAR Toronto, Google, Tenamint\\\\nPartnerships (Prospective):\\\\nHackbox\\\\nWilfrid Laurier University\\\\nHawkHacks\\\\nWaterloo Blockchain\\\\nGeorge Brown College\\\\nBitcoin Bay (Canada)\\\\nToronto Metropolitan University\\\\nKeyPom\\\\nTENAMINT\\\\nFairlyAI\\\\nGoogle Firebase & Gemini\\\\n\\\\n**3. Event Objectives**\\\\n\\\\nGoals:\\\\nThe primary goal is to accelerate the expansion of the NEAR ecosystem, embracing core principles of decentralization, transparency, self-sufficiency, resilience, and rapid innovation. Expected outcomes include a strengthened NEAR community in and around Toronto, increased visibility and engagement with the NEAR platform globally, and the promotion of innovative blockchain solutions developed by the participants.\\\\nTarget Audience:\\\\nOur hackathon is specifically designed for the young, innovative development talent from Canada, with a special focus on students and emerging developers from University and College partners within the Toronto and Waterloo areas which have historically featured some of the most innovative, motivated, and talented young hackers, developers, creators, and builders in blockchain technology.\\\\n\\\\n**4. Challenges & Themes**\\\\nDetails:\\\\nThe hackathon will introduce a series of challenges and themes aimed at pushing the boundaries of blockchain technology and its interoperability. Specific areas of focus include:\\\\nInteroperability/Multi-chain Solutions: Participants will tackle challenges related to Chain Signatures and Chain Abstraction, aiming to enhance the NEAR ecosystem\\\\\\'s compatibility and interaction with other blockchain networks.\\\\nAI & Blockchain Track: This track invites participants to explore the innovative intersection of AI technologies and blockchain, aiming to develop solutions that leverage the strengths of both domains.\\\\nBlockchain Operating Systems (BOS): A challenge that dives into the future of blockchain infrastructure, seeking innovative ideas and solutions that could redefine how blockchain ecosystems operate and scale.\\\\nWe are open to additional suggestions/direction for challenges and themes from the NEAR Dev Hub.\\\\n\\\\n**5. Schedule and Activities**\\\\n\\\\nPhase 1: HackHawks Waterloo & Global\\\\nMay 15 - Pre-Hackathon Virtual Events:\\\\n\\\\nIdea Sharing and Team Building Session.\\\\nMay 17 - Kickoff in Waterloo, ON:\\\\nOpening Ceremonies and Introductions (IRL in Waterloo & Virtual).\\\\nWorkshop(s).\\\\nMay 18:\\\\nPartner Workshop(s) (IRL in Waterloo & Virtual).\\\\nMay 19:\\\\nHawkHacks submissions due\\\\nFeedback sessions for participants with NEAR track intent.\\\\nFeedback sessions for promising submissions with a good NEAR fit.\\\\nPlus, weekly office hours.\\\\nMay 24 - 30\\\\nOffice Hours\\\\nWorkshops\\\\nMay 31st:\\\\nAll final submissions due\\\\nNote: The extended deadline offers hackathon participants additional time to refine their projects and adapt them for the NEAR Tracks. This period includes dedicated office hours, essential resources, and specialized workshops that will be available between the initial and final submission dates.\\\\n\\\\n**6. KPIs and Impact**\\\\n\\\\n120+ Developers\\\\n20+ Submissions/Projects Developed\\\\nImpact:\\\\n\\\\nFostering Innovation: Introducing fresh ideas from talented young developers from Canada and beyond.\\\\nExpanding Community: Growing the NEAR community through university partnerships.\\\\nEnhancing Skills: Providing blockchain education to empower future developers.\\\\nIncreasing Engagement: Deepening technical involvement within the NEAR ecosystem.\\\\n\\\\n**7. Budget and Funding**\\\\n\\\\nTotal Request:\\\\nHackathon: $10,000 covering prizes, staffing, marketing, venues, food and beverages, and workshops. Additional sponsorship funding will be added.\\\\nProposal 1 Budget\\\\n\\\\n**8. Bounties and Prizes**\\\\n\\\\nAwards: $5000\\\\n$2,500 for 1st place\\\\n$1,500 for 2nd place\\\\n$1,000 for 3rd place\\\\nPlus, additional bounties from other sources.\\\\n\\\\n**9. Judging Criteria**\\\\n\\\\nCode Quality: Assess readability, structure, maintainability, naming conventions, modularity, use of best practices, and documentation.\\\\nEcosystem Usefulness: Evaluate the project\\\\\\'s impact within its ecosystem, solving real problems, filling market gaps, or enhancing existing solutions.\\\\nLongevity: Consider sustainability and growth potential, likelihood of ongoing maintenance, updates, and support.\\\\nOriginality: Judge novelty, innovative approaches, creative technology use, and uniqueness in problem-solving.\\\\nProduct / UX: Evaluate user experience and design, focusing on usability, aesthetic appeal, accessibility, and interface intuitiveness.\\\\nAbstraction: Assess ability to simplify and abstract complexity, providing a user-friendly interface that hides unnecessary details.\\\\nCompleteness: Judge the project\\\\\\'s readiness for use, considering bugs, feature completion, and overall polish.\\\\n\\\\n**10. Marketing and Promotion**\\\\nCollaborative Promotion: Leveraging partnerships within the NEAR ecosystem and with local community channels to broaden our reach. This multifaceted approach ensures we connect with a diverse audience across different platforms and communities.\\\\nCommunity Partnerships: Utilizing existing relationships with community partners to expand our visibility. These partnerships are instrumental in amplifying our message and attracting participants who are already aligned with our values and interests.\\\\nPartner Hackathons: A cornerstone of our strategy is collaboration with established hackathons, such as Hawkhacks which have historically attracted over 700 and 150 registrations, respectively. These events provide us with a pool of developers already interested in hackathons, significantly reducing the barrier to entry. Our primary marketing efforts are focused on these qualified and interested candidates, aiming to educate and raise awareness about the opportunities within the NEAR ecosystem.\\\\n\\\\n**11. Contact Information**\\\\n\\\\nTelegram: @salshuttlesworth\\\\nEmail: neartorontohub@gmail.com\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "toronto-sc.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "10000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Hackbox", "Hackathon"]}

KPIs and Impact**\\\\n\\\\n120+ Developers\\\\n20+ Submissions/Projects Developed\\\\nImpact:\\\\n\\\\nFostering Innovation: Introducing fresh ideas from talented young developers from Canada and beyond.\\\\nExpanding Community: Growing the NEAR community through university partnerships.\\\\nEnhancing Skills: Providing blockchain education to empower future developers.\\\\nIncreasing Engagement: Deepening technical involvement within the NEAR ecosystem.\\\\n\\\\n**7. Judging Criteria**\\\\n\\\\nCode Quality: Assess readability, structure, maintainability, naming conventions, modularity, use of best practices, and documentation.\\\\nEcosystem Usefulness: Evaluate the project\\\\\\'s impact within its ecosystem, solving real problems, filling market gaps, or enhancing existing solutions.\\\\nLongevity: Consider sustainability and growth potential, likelihood of ongoing maintenance, updates, and support.\\\\nOriginality: Judge novelty, innovative approaches, creative technology use, and uniqueness in problem-solving.\\\\nProduct / UX: Evaluate user experience and design, focusing on usability, aesthetic appeal, accessibility, and interface intuitiveness.\\\\nAbstraction: Assess ability to simplify and abstract complexity, providing a user-friendly interface that hides unnecessary details.\\\\nCompleteness: Judge the project\\\\\\'s readiness for use, considering bugs, feature completion, and overall polish.\\\\n\\\\n**10. These partnerships are instrumental in amplifying our message and attracting participants who are already aligned with our values and interests.\\\\nPartner Hackathons: A cornerstone of our strategy is collaboration with established hackathons, such as Hawkhacks which have historically attracted over 700 and 150 registrations, respectively.
